thread.title: GHMC Commissioner Amrapali Kata: Keep streets free of garbage in Hyderabad |
thread.title_full: GHMC Commissioner Amrapali Kata: Keep streets free of garbage in Hyderabad | Hyderabad News - Times of India

title: GHMC Commissioner Amrapali Kata: Keep streets free of garbage in Hyderabad |
text: Hyderabad: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) commissioner Amrapali Kata directed authorities to pay special attention to removal of Garbage Vulnerable Points. On Thursday, the commissioner conducted a surprise inspection on sanitation in various parts of the city including Kukatpally, Moosapet Bharat, Nagar and Rythu Bazar areas. GHMC officials were directed to keep the streets free of garbage from time to time to ensure a clean environment.tnnWe also published the following articles recentlyCantt assets, liabilities to be transferred to Greater Hyderabad Municipal CorporationMinistry of Defence announces transfer of civilian areas from Secunderabad Cantonment to Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation. Get insights into the process and guidelines outlined for this transition. Learn more!111372819Ludhiana Deputy Commissioner visits flood-vulnerable areas along with Sutlej, checks work of cleaning drainsDeputy Commissioner Sakshi Sawhney oversees flood vulnerable points and drain cleaning work in Ludhiana district. Emphasis on expediting cleaning process with two poclain machines and stocking sandbags for emergencies. Officials working diligently to prevent floods during the upcoming rainy season.111386132Charity commissioner squad stopped from inspectionLearn about the recent complaint filed against Aditya Birla Memorial Hospital for obstructing an inspection related to free treatment for poor patients. The hospital denied the allegations and cooperated by submitting necessary documents for inspection.111353106
